brand_info.name: Reebok
brand_info.tagline: Life Is Not a Spectator Sport.
brand_info.positioning: A global athletic brand rooted in fitness culture, positioned around functional performance, training heritage, and everyday athletic lifestyle.
brand_info.vision: To be the best fitness brand in the world.
brand_info.mission: Empower people to be their best selves through movement, training, and fitness-driven innovation.
brand_info.origin_story: Founded in 1958 in Bolton, England by Joe and Jeff Foster as a continuation of J.W. Foster and Sons, Reebok originated from a legacy of performance footwear for athletes and evolved into a global fitness-focused sports brand.

brand_values.brand_promise: Deliver functional, credible products inspired by real training, fitness culture, and everyday movement.
differentiators: Deep heritage in fitness, training, and functional movement rather than sport spectacle.
Strong cultural roots in aerobics, gym culture, and training communities.
Clear positioning around training, fitness, and lifestyle crossover rather than competition-first sports.
Iconic footwear franchises bridging performance and street culture.
non_negotiables: Maintain fitness-first credibility across products and campaigns.
Protect Reebok’s training and movement heritage.
Keep messaging authentic, human, and grounded in real movement.
Avoid drifting into performance claims not rooted in training reality.

psychographics.lifestyle: Fitness-oriented consumers balancing gym training, wellness, and everyday active lifestyles with a cultural awareness of sport and streetwear.
psychographics.behavior: Regular training participation, interest in functional footwear and apparel, appreciation for heritage silhouettes and fitness-driven storytelling.

tone_of_voice.communication_style: Direct, motivating, and human-centered, grounded in real fitness and training experiences.
preferred_structures: Human-centered messaging around effort and progress
tone_dos: Keep claims tied to real training benefits
tone_donts: Abstract brand manifestos disconnected from fitness

logo.usage_rules: Ensure high contrast and clarity; avoid distortion or decorative effects.
logo.lockup_behavior: Wordmark or Vector logo used contextually; maintain consistency and clear spacing.
logo.safe_area: Minimum padding equals the height of the 'R' in the wordmark.

color_system.color_usage_rules: Neutral athletic base with selective accent colors inspired by training heritage and seasonal collections.

typography.primary_font: Bold modern sans-serif with athletic character

layout_principles.grid_system: Strong modular grid with athletic clarity
layout_principles.cta_placement: Lower third or integrated into compositions
layout_principles.alignment: Dynamic but readable compositions reflecting movement

preferred_photographers: Fitness and training photographers with documentary sensibility
Lifestyle photographers capturing real movement and sweat
Studio photographers emphasizing function and durability
style.camera_feel: Direct, energetic imagery emphasizing effort, form, and real training environments.
style.pose_guidelines: Functional movement, exertion, and recovery moments; avoid overly posed hero stances.
style.casting_attitude: Everyday athletes and diverse fitness communities; credibility over perfection.

technical.lighting: Natural or gritty studio lighting reflecting gym environments.
technical.grain: Low to moderate for texture and realism.
technical.color_grading: Natural with slightly desaturated or gritty tones.

product_presentation.hero_visibility: Function, stability, and construction clarity prioritized.

motion_rules.pacing: Energetic and rhythmic, aligned with training intensity.
motion_rules.transitions: Hard cuts and minimal graphic overlays.

must_remain: Reebok wordmark and Vector logo integrity

platform_behavior.Instagram: Training content, community features, heritage footwear drops

print.cover_rules: Strong human movement imagery; minimal copy

logo_misuse_examples: Over-layering logos on busy training imagery
